42c027e4ff9730fbb3de84c1af0d2c506e41c3e4:
Here is a 3-line summary:

Daniel Radcliffe turns 18 and inherits £20 million fortune from Harry Potter films.
He plans to spend his money wisely on books, CDs, and DVDs, not on lavish parties or cars.
Radcliffe aims to keep his feet grounded despite growing fame and riches.
ee8871b15c50d0db17b0179a6d2beab35065f1e9:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary of the article:

Mentally ill inmates are housed on the "forgotten floor" of Miami's pretrial detention facility until they're ready for trial.
Judge Steven Leifman advocates for justice and mental health treatment, saying the system is overwhelmed and inhumane.
A new mental health facility will provide long-term treatment instead of punishment, a win-win solution for patients, families, and the state.
06352019a19ae31e527f37f7571c6dd7f0c5da37:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary of the article:

Drivers describe harrowing tales of survival after Minneapolis bridge collapse.
Survivors recount free-fall falls, cars in water and on fire, and chaos as they rescued others.
Rescue efforts were controlled and organized, with volunteers and officials working to evacuate 55 people from the scene.
24521a2abb2e1f5e34e6824e0f9e56904a2b0e88:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary:

President Bush had five small polyps removed from his colon during a procedure on Saturday.
The polyps were sent for microscopic examination and results are expected in two to three days.
Bush is in good humor and will resume activities at Camp David, with Vice President Cheney assuming presidential power during the procedure.
7fe70cc8b12fab2d0a258fababf7d9c6b5e1262a:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary:

NFL suspends Michael Vick indefinitely without pay due to dogfighting ring involvement.
Vick admitted to participating in the ring and killing dogs that didn't fight well, according to court documents.
The suspension makes "a strong statement that conduct which tarnishes the good reputation of the NFL will not be tolerated," said Falcons owner Arthur Blank.
a1ebb8bb4d370a1fdf28769206d572be60642d70:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary:

5-year-old Youssif, severely burned by masked men, receives outpouring of support from around the world.
The Children's Burn Foundation will cover medical costs and provide housing for Youssif and his family in the US.
Youssif's parents are grateful for the new hope and care their son will receive, saying they'll do anything to help him recover.
7c0e61ac829a3b3b653e2e3e7536cc4881d1f264:
Iraqi women are turning to prostitution due to poverty and lack of government aid, with some earning as little as $8 a day.
Suha, a mother of three, says she's forced into prostitution to feed her children, despite feeling ashamed and afraid.
Karima, another mother, turned to prostitution after her husband died, leaving her with nothing, and now sacrifices herself for her five children.
f0d73bdab711763e745cdc75850861c9018f235d:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary:

Colombian military killed key FARC rebel commander Tomas Medina Caracas in an air attack.
He was wanted by US authorities for cocaine trafficking and kidnapping charges.
Fourteen rebels were found dead at the jungle camp, along with weapons and GPS systems.
5e22bbfc7232418b8d2dd646b952e404df5bd048:
Here is a 3-line summary:

Tony Snow, White House press secretary, steps down September 14 due to cancer treatment.
He will be replaced by deputy press secretary Dana Perino.
Snow's health is improving, and he plans to continue speaking out on issues after leaving his post.
613d6311ec2c1985bd44707d1796d275452fe156:
Here is a 3-line summary:

An empty rocket launcher tube was found on a Jersey City home's front lawn.
The FBI and local police are investigating its origin and whether it was fired recently.
The device, an AT4 anti-tank weapon, is no longer operable and not considered a hazard to public safety.
017d27d00eb43678c15cb4a8dd4723a035323219:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary:

President Bush will argue against withdrawing from Iraq by invoking historical lessons from Vietnam.
He claims that US withdrawal from Vietnam emboldened terrorists and led to innocent citizens' suffering.
Bush's speech aims to provide broader context for the upcoming Iraq progress report, amid growing public opposition to the war.
85f55a3e0dd672857aaaaa80954934a57b7a2fbf:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary of the article:

Bombings and attempted attacks have plagued mainland UK since the 1970s.
Recent incidents include a foiled plot in August 2004 and a failed attack on July 21, 2005.
The IRA has been responsible for many of these attacks, with Al Qaeda claiming responsibility for some as well.
77d7c8cf2a9432e395d629371a12790c563c19f7:
Carlos Alberto joins Werder Bremen for €7.8 million, a club record fee.
He previously played for FC Porto and Corinthians in Portugal and Brazil.
The 22-year-old midfielder aims to win titles with his new team.
He started his career at Fluminense before moving to Europe.
35f0e33de7923036a97ac245d899f990bda5e242:
Vice President Dick Cheney will serve as acting president while President Bush undergoes colonoscopy.

Procedure expected to take about 2 1/2 hours and is routine maintenance for the president's health.

Bush's last colonoscopy was in June 2002, and no abnormalities were found.

The procedure aims to detect colon cancer, rectal cancer, and polyps.
2ad31cae96512af5105b9b23f9b681dc732b2605:
A magnitude 4.2 earthquake struck San Francisco at 4:42 a.m.
The quake left about 2,000 customers without power.
It was considered "light" and caused minimal damage.
Shaking lasted around 50 seconds, with some alarms triggered.
0d43b97000ff852282c89d8d105e41495c0ee9bd:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary of the article:

Federal officials have exhausted all options in searching for six trapped miners in Utah's Crandall Canyon Mine.
The mine collapsed on August 6, and despite efforts to reach the men, there has been no sign of life or sound from them.
Rescue operations have ended, with officials saying they have "run out of options" and the mine will be permanently closed.
bf0cd4ccacd4fe045995338f4c44d9cf18000226:
At least 14 killed and 60 wounded in bomb blast near mosque in Batna, Algeria.
Bomb exploded 15 minutes before President Abdel-Aziz Bouteflika's expected arrival.
No immediate claim of responsibility for the bombing; investigation ongoing.
President visits hospital to see wounded before returning to Algiers.
2f43e9dfaa43ffbddbce339a8b6403ddce43b38a:
David Beckham joins LA Galaxy in five-year contract.
Beckham's journey from east London to Hollywood Hills explored.
He fulfilled his dream of playing for Manchester United and England.

(Note: The summary is limited to three lines as per your request, but if you'd like a four-line summary, I can provide that as well!)
eb68bc51ed4fc727a1af058192a3fef0916c91e7:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary:

A virus found in healthy Australian honey bees may be linked to US colony collapse disorder, which has killed millions of bees.
The Israeli Acute Paralysis Virus (IAPV) was present in 96% of bees from collapsed hives, but Australian bees seem resistant to the disease.
Researchers say IAPV is likely not acting alone and that other stressors on colonies are involved, offering hope for breeding bees with genetic resistance.
ad021a7924ee57491cee8576499ac196b1afeb23:
Savers line up at Northern Rock branches to withdraw cash after bank's profit forecasts are slashed.
Customers have already withdrawn £1 billion since the bank's woes were revealed, sparking speculation about the global credit crunch.
The British Bankers' Association urges customers to "calm down", assuring them that Northern Rock is a sound and safe bank.
The Bank of England steps in to create a stable banking system, allowing Northern Rock to continue its business as usual.
9d7fc7fd9ffbfecb1c458b9929fa02e6c3538368:
O.J. Simpson arrested on robbery and assault charges in Las Vegas.
He will be held without bail, accused of directing an armed robbery at a hotel room.
Simpson allegedly pointed firearms at victims, but did not brandish one himself.
Investigations are ongoing to identify four other men who accompanied him into the room.
30cb674030b01014d2c87b92f09152857e249631:
Nigeria's TV survival show "Gulder Ultimate Search" suspended after contestant drowns in preparation.

25-year-old Anthony Ogadje died suddenly while preparing for the show at Shere Hills Lake.

All attempts to revive him failed, including efforts by medical team, lifeguards, and fellow contestants.
d41dc7fc05273a37f0aceaf4f3e35a187f12653e:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary of the article:

A former government contract employee, Roy Lynn Oakley, was indicted for stealing restricted nuclear energy-related materials from East Tennessee Technology Park.
Oakley allegedly took the materials in January and attempted to sell them to someone he thought was a French agent, but was actually an undercover FBI agent.
He faces up to 10 years in prison and a $250,000 fine if convicted.
fbc6a4d0697b2a3e8b549dcb1f80a8ce7bf47e34:
John Terry's fitness uncertain ahead of Chelsea's Champions League match with Valencia.
Frank Lampard ruled out due to thigh injury, Michael Essien expected to play.
Terry trained with face mask after surgery on Sunday, decision pending.
Grant will assess Terry's condition before making a final decision.
0753a471e6908c35bcbc2daa37e21f3a8443b590:
Here is a 3-line summary of the article:

A dire shortage of donated organs in rich countries has led to a black market for organ trafficking and transplant tourism.
In poorer countries like China, Pakistan, Turkey, Egypt, Colombia, and the Philippines, people are selling their kidneys and livers to foreigners for thousands of dollars.
The trade is often unregulated and lacks transparency, with donors facing risks and recipients paying exorbitant prices.
08450c1bc03472825196be1acb02ac0e13bef939:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary:

Lindsay Lohan's legal troubles have Hollywood wondering if she's too risky to cast in films.
Insurance experts say even problematic stars can be covered, but at a high cost.
The industry has dealt with similar situations before and will likely require higher deductibles or escrow payments.
7fa8d9beca50155fd3d71a9087a4311ce321c34b:
Francesco Totti threatens to quit Italian Players Association over Serie A season start date.
Totti complains that players are never listened to and wants to start season on August 19.
Italian Football League ignored request from coach Roberto Donadoni for earlier start date.
Serie A is one of the last major European leagues to start next season.
414a5b8ecbe189d2767c75b839775a1dcafaf4d3:
Blackwater USA denies allegations of illegal arms activities in Iraq.
Federal prosecutors investigate Blackwater employees for weapon sales.
Company fired two employees caught stealing, invited ATF investigation.
State Department cooperating with probe, Blackwater resumes normal operations.
cac7a712935380d74410a7cba8d406235d51249a:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary of the article:

Youssif, a 5-year-old Iraqi boy burned by masked men, meets his favorite superhero Spider-Man at Universal Studios.
The boy, who has been through trauma and nightmares, enjoys a day of fun and play with SpongeBob, Lassie, and other superheroes.
Despite facing violence and chaos in Baghdad, the family finds solace and generosity in America, calling it "good America".
e9093ca0a82f2aba28cd2762942c04177cfbb000:
Marine Cpl. Trent D. Thomas sentenced to reduction in rank and discharge for role in Iraqi civilian's death.
Thomas found guilty of kidnapping, conspiracy, and murder in April 2006 death of Hashim Ibrahim Awad.
He will be demoted to entry-level private and receive a bad-conduct discharge.
Thomas initially pleaded guilty but later changed his plea to not guilty, claiming he followed orders.
55a6aabd120f0b18297f7efe22452f9b3aca0d8d:
Here is a 3-line summary:

Prince Harry led tributes to his mother, Princess Diana, on her 10th anniversary death, describing her as "the best mother in the world". He spoke of her love and laughter, and how she made them happy. The memorial service honored her public work and legacy, including her efforts to overcome prejudice and stigma around AIDS and landmines.
06bc2f0272d033b123e9eebbb221c62d7d51c283:
French Foreign Minister Bernard Kouchner warns of war against Iran over nuclear program.
Kouchner's reputation for challenging convention and authority precedes him.
France's new high-profile style under President Nicolas Sarkozy emphasizes human rights concerns.
Kouchner echoes President Sarkozy's warnings, saying a nuclear-armed Iran would be "unacceptable".
17e43e8e7d2bbbb237df78537d108c3fa917d9fb:
Here is the summary:

• "Für Elise" was written by Beethoven, but its original title was "Bagatelle in A minor", and some scholars speculate it was written for Therese Malfatti.
• "Philadelphia Freedom" was written by Elton John and Bernie Taupin as a thank-you to Billie Jean King for a tracksuit, referencing her pro tennis team, The Philadelphia Freedoms.
• "Lola" was written by Ray Davies of The Kinks, possibly inspired by Candy Darling or the band's manager's drunken night with a woman.
• "867-5309/Jenny" was written by Jim Keller and Alex Call, but its inspiration remains unknown, despite various stories from the songwriters.
• "Oh, Carol" was written by Neil Sedaka for Carole King, who later wrote a rebuttal, "Oh, Neil", which helped her and Gerry Goffin land jobs at the Brill Building.
ddcdeb9bdd19fa23f9495c85d48eeee910f33102:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary:

Historic spending expected in 2008 election cycle, exceeding $3 billion.
Presidential candidates and interest groups are buying TV time, with Mitt Romney leading in ad spending.
TV ads will focus on early states like Iowa, New Hampshire, and South Carolina, with issues like healthcare and the Iraq war taking center stage.
ee0ba7928d8987f2cb21c9a2012a76730f77de45:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary:

Relatives of plane crash victims arrive in Phuket to identify loved ones.
Most of the 89 killed were foreign nationals, with 36 bodies still unidentified.
The investigation into the crash continues, with strong winds and rain suspected as a factor.
554fd99f28ae12472c5d99ef6383bb184744c25a:
Michael Moore and Dr. Sanjay Gupta debated healthcare issues on CNN's "Larry King Live".
Moore criticized Gupta's report on his documentary "Sicko", saying facts were fudged.
Both agreed that America's healthcare system is broken, but disagreed on solutions.
9e141ebc1c06d483bf85f4e5c8b3c7bc2d00ea2f:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary of the article:

House Democrats may delay voting on a resolution labeling Turkey's treatment of Armenians as genocide.
Turkey has threatened to block access to Incirlik Air Base, a key resupply center for US operations in Iraq and Afghanistan.
The Pentagon is preparing alternative supply routes if Turkey cuts off access, with Jordan and Kuwait among the alternatives being considered.
c9160e2f5ce386dabb10517e7a5c0933c01a9546:
Twelve-year-old Mohammed Rasoul lost his leg in an explosion and is now awaiting surgery in the US.
His mother, Jinan Khalifa, remembers the day of the explosion and its aftermath.
Mohammed will receive a prosthetic leg and additional surgery at Shriners Children Hospital in Philadelphia.
d256aee1a47eb5b489dee6fb72ab7f7d1483a37f:
India elects its first female president, Pratibha Patil, in a vote by parliament and state politicians.
Patil won about two-thirds of the electoral college votes, despite a bitter campaign marked by scandal.
Her presidency is seen as a boost for women's rights, but her campaign was marred by controversy over financial irregularities and divisive comments.
2fff2bc541ef34a6647dfa2e4294cdcc187e47b9:
Here is a 3-line summary:

Over 100 homes in San Diego's La Jolla community were evacuated after a massive landslide destroyed part of a road and some multimillion-dollar homes.
The landslide, which began cracking the road in July, opened up a 20-foot-deep chasm beneath the road and homes, forcing residents to flee for their lives.
At least one home was destroyed, several others damaged, and nine are still off-limits due to safety concerns.
677375a4c69e81ab623af7c06a6b0a8d03d6350e:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary of the article:

Most of the 103 children taken by French charity Zoe's Ark from Chad are not Sudanese orphans, but rather living with their families in Chadian villages.
The charity was accused of kidnapping and concealing the children's identities, and its workers and journalists were arrested and charged with kidnapping and extortion.
International aid agencies, including the Red Cross, UNHCR, and UNICEF, have been investigating the case and say most of the children are from Chadian villages near the Sudanese border.
33530f97118cc905b05cb920671492c7bfdf3a3b:
Here is a 3-line summary of the article:

Explorer Dennis Schmitt discovered an island near Greenland, revealing climate change's impact.
The discovery shows significant ice melt, which could lead to catastrophic sea-level rises and flooding.
Scientists agree that global warming is occurring, but debate its causes and potential consequences.
3c19a753303ae0d67b3ae28e070c0f4157ffc52d:
Here is a 3-line summary of the article:

Ethiopian soldier's body dragged through Mogadishu streets after gun battles kill 19.
Crowds shouted "God is great" as they pulled the bruised, bullet-riddled corpse through a dusty neighborhood.
Fighting between Ethiopian troops and insurgents drives hundreds more people from their homes.
9313988d26672c576f08e130c895edf20d8aa626:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary:

Stacy Peterson, 23, has been missing from her suburban Chicago home since October 28 and authorities now consider it a potential homicide.
Her husband, Drew Peterson, a police sergeant, is a suspect and investigators have searched their home and vehicles twice.
The case has also raised questions about the death of Peterson's third wife, Kathleen Savio, which was initially ruled an accident but may be reclassified as a homicide.
72f4a6670ec7ec915c83d58bb0ebf152b1605bb6:
Julia Vakulenko faces Lindsay Davenport in her first WTA Tour final at the Bell Challenge.

Vakulenko battled past Julie Ditty in the semifinals, seeking her first victory on the WTA Tour.

Davenport seeks her second win in three tournaments since returning from a one-year hiatus to have a baby.

The two players will face off in the final with Vakulenko looking to try her best and Davenport aiming to be on the offensive.
b73f50e29d5b2943eb315643bef8ee4e09f5605b:
Pakistani President Pervez Musharraf declares state of emergency, suspends constitution and dismisses chief justice.
Troops take control of TV station's equipment and opposition leader Javed Hashmi is placed under house arrest.
Musharraf claims actions are necessary to restore law and order in the country, but faces condemnation from within and outside Pakistan.
f9689fb9656132e1c6d186851563f2b968643791:
Here is a 3-line highlights summary of the article:

Robert Singer, COO of National Children's Museum, arrested for distributing child pornography.
He allegedly sent explicit images to an undercover detective posing as a mother and daughter.
Singer faces up to 140 years in prison if convicted on five counts of distributing child pornography.
63831b842812b1a3d05b04904a10d160fe7ad2af:
Chester Stiles appears in court on charges of raping a 2-year-old girl.
Prosecutors add more charges, bringing total to 23 felony counts.
Girl's mother says she is relieved by Stiles' arrest but wishes he were dead.
Former girlfriends describe living in fear after recognizing suspect from videotape.
05688bac0e46542be65a6df240428a6f26c86fd0:
Dale Steyn takes career-best 5 for 34 as South Africa dominates first test against New Zealand.

New Zealand bowled out for 118 in reply to South Africa's 226, then struggles in second innings.

Hashim Amla and Jacques Kallis share unbeaten stand of 159, stretching South Africa's lead to 287.
5ba0d22ccba29ac8a3c77da069165d6016f5a214:
Here are five great ways to enjoy your summer:

• Cut jeans into shorts by marking the desired length, folding and ironing the leg, and cutting just under the crease.
• Catch fireflies by finding a female's blinking pattern and imitating it with a pen flashlight.
• Run on the beach by taking it slow, wearing shoes or going barefoot briefly, and knowing your sand type.
• Get in and out of a hammock by positioning yourself correctly, sitting back into the hammock, and swinging your legs up and out.
• Tie espadrilles by sliding your foot fully into the shoe, crossing and tying the laces behind the ankle, and securing them slightly tighter than comfortable.
